attributes.action:
Impose regulations on the use of models whose body mass
index is below 18.5.
attributes.background:
This petition is to introduce a law prohibiting the use of models whose BMI is below 18.5 (the lowest healthy BMI considered by medical professionals). 
This requirement would necessitate a medical certificate from a
physician, to ensure the model is in good health.
attributes.additional_details:
This applies to models used in advertising, media, fashion shows,
catwalk shows and for any other other promotional purposes, and
applies to both male and female models.

The purpose of this requirement is to prohibit the normalisation of
low body weights and the glamorisation of an unhealthy body image.
Instead, using models with a healthy BMI of 18.5 or above would
re-calibrate the public perception of a ‘normal’ body shape and weight.

attributes.action: Make the DNA testing of dogs compulsory in order to compile a national database
attributes.background: The DNA testing of dog mess is already offered by some companies and could be used to find a dog owner guilty of such an offence. The problem is there is no database for the DNA of dogs, and owners are not obliged by law to register them. A database would allow an unequivocal conviction to be made.

attributes.action: Ask Parliament to debate the Basic Income
attributes.background: Britain is the 6th richest country on earth, yet 1/3rd of British children live in poverty. 3.8 million Brits in work live in poverty. A majority of people live paycheck to paycheck. The botched rollout of universal credits made matters worse. It's time for parliament to debate the basic income.
attributes.additional_details:
In the face of these devastating facts, many people have argued that giving everyone a small, monthly sum of money to cover their basic needs, without any work requirement, would significantly salvage the situation. This is what's called a basic income.

All we ask is for parliament to put all the ideas that may help deal with the issues outlined above on the table. That is literally their job. It's what they get paid to do. Ask parliament to debate the basic income.

attributes.action: Scrap the tampon tax. Reduce the price of all sanitary products.
attributes.background: Women spend on average £13 a month on sanitary products. Some women have to chose between food and sanitary products. Women don't make the choice to have a period. It is not a luxury but the government classes it as one.
attributes.additional_details: There is  5% tax on sanitary products. Condoms are given out for free whereas there is a tax on sanitary products.  You can choose to abstain from sex but you can't help having a period.

attributes.action: Reduce the overseas aid to 0.2% of GNI.
attributes.background: We should reduce our overseas aid budget of 0.7% of (GNI) to 0.2% of GNI to come in-line with other European Countries and America. Based on the £12b budget of 2015 this would leave us with an additional £8b which should be immediately allocated to the NHS and social care budgets.
attributes.additional_details: We also ask that all overseas aid should be means tested before any Country is allocated any money at all. This will stop the waste of hundreds of millions that goes to Countries with space programs for example or are fighting wars with their neighbours and their own people.

attributes.action: Help stop the government plans to decentralise ALL sexual violence funding.
attributes.background: At RASA Merseyside we are trying to #shinealight into the darkness of the hidden horrors of rape and sexual abuse. More individuals are coming forward and asking for support. Recently funding for sexual violence support services has remained constant or dropped.
attributes.additional_details: This plan in 2018/19 would be disastrous for many services, despite the evidence pointing to the problems this will cause for established services that rely on such funding for their core service delivery. It is likely there will be less support available for survivors, as decentralised funds are consumed by other priority local needs. We can already see a decrease in service levels and an increase in waiting times for support. We ask that the government urgently reconsider this proposed action.

attributes.action: Make FCO Consular Services statutory, defined and guaranteed
attributes.background: FCO Consular Service is subject to abuse and discrimination. British nationals abroad cannot rely upon the published FCO Customer Charter, as it has an enormous caveat; all help is discretionary, not statutory. British nationals currently have no recourse against the FCO for failing to help them.
attributes.additional_details: Cases prove that one British national will receive consular service while another does not for the exact same needs. The Gillian Gibbons Sudan case proved that the FCO will intervene significantly more the less important the country. Brexit especially requires that the FCO publish a charter that they will honour for each and every British citizen abroad irrespective of the country involved. Also that the FCO is more proactive in cases of civil and human rights abuse.

attributes.action: Equalise survivor benefits for widows & widowers in the Teachers Pension Scheme.
attributes.background: The Teachers Pension Scheme provides survivor benefits for the spouses of teachers who have paid into the occupational pension scheme. However, there is a difference in what a teacher's widow or widower receives. A man's widow will get 50% of his pension, but a woman's widower is likely to get less.
attributes.additional_details: Historically, men and women teachers have paid exactly the same contributions into the pension scheme, and will receive equal pensions (based on their years of service and salary level). The scheme provides for their surviving partners to receive 50% of their pension. However, for the purposes of calculating these survivors benefits, male teachers leaving a widow have all their years of service from 1972 included. Female teachers (and same-sex couples) have all service prior to 1988 disregarded.

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit return to old system!
attributes.background: New universal credit replaces JSA, income support, ESA, Housing benefit, Tax credits and working tax credits. Government says universal credit will make work pay. This is rubbish. Universal credit is about cutting the social security bill meaning millions will be worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Once fully implemented will mean easier sanctioning forcing people to live on nothing. Housing subsidy will be time limited forcing more to be homeless. Support for childcare will be drastically cut. Disability element's cut or abolished altogether. Some rates are much lower than current benefit rates. Government has so far wasted hundreds of millions. They will save billions taking from the needy and most vulnerable in our society. This is a war against the poor. Whilst they prop up the rich!

attributes.action: Guarantee equal or better funding for scientific research in the UK after Brexit
attributes.background: We rely heavily on EU research funding ~€1.2 billion p.a. from Horizon 2020, there is no clear plan on how this will be replaced after Brexit. I ask that the future funding is guaranteed and extra UK grants are made that at least match or better the input from Horizon 2020 to UK HE institutions.
attributes.additional_details:
At time of writing, there is no deal for joint EU-UK research funding after Brexit. The UK will not have access to the same amount of funding and hundreds of top level research jobs will be lost due to the shortfall, unless the UK government increases domestic research budgets. https://ec.europa.eu/unitedkingdom/news/uk-institutions-and-researchers-top-recipients-eu-innovation-funding_en

UK HE institutes received ~€1.2 billion in 2015 http://ec.europa.eu/budget/figures/interactive/index_en.cfm

attributes.action: Ban paper receipts in the UK unless specifically requested by the customer.
attributes.background: Over 11 billion receipts are printed each year in the UK alone. The majority of these are discarded straight to the bin. This has a devastating effect on our environment and the future of our planet. We must stop receipts being handed out as a matter of habit and dramatically reduce this number.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a digital age where a receipt can be emailed at the click of a button. Eventually we should be phasing out paper receipts altogether, but for now the government need to take the first step of making it illegal for all shops and companies to hand out receipts without a customer specifically requesting one.

attributes.action: The government should not be transferring all EU Regulations into British law.
attributes.background:
All EU law is bad law.  We do not want one single word of it in British law. The government is transferring 170,000 pages of EU Regulations and Directives into English law. 
It is all just EU Red Tape and it is strangling British industry. 
Say no to the Acquis Communautaire.

attributes.action: Enable an ESA - Emotional Support Animal to be recognized as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I am wanting ESA (Emotional Support Animal) Service Dogs to be allowed to be recognized as an Assistance Service Dog along with Blind Guide Service Dogs.They should be allowed into restaurants/pubs/etc as they help people like myself who have Mental Health Issues/Mental Health Disabilities.
attributes.additional_details: I have panic attacks in my home and in public places. After I rescued Summer they aren't as bad or as common. When she knows something is wrong, she runs to me, sits down&begins licking me. The dog I rescued now helps with something I had to face several times a day. I need her with me in public places, just like others who need a Service Dog with them, we need to recognize ESA Service Dogs as Assistance Dogs too.

attributes.action: Remove all Tolls to cross over/under the River Mersey, via Bridges or Tunnels.
attributes.background:
The Mersey Tunnels have been tolled for years
The Mersey Road Bridges are following suit
The NW region  is struggling economically. 
Bring all Mersey crossings back into the National Roads structure, like similar structures in Wales and Scotland. This will develop a real "Northern Powerhouse".

attributes.action: Make medicinal cannabis legal for long term mental/physical health conditions
attributes.background: I have had cerebral palsy since birth and suffer with chronic pain and stiffness every day causing a very limited life. Now being housebound, I would love your help to enjoy life and I believe medicinal cannabis (high cbd/low thc) could help control/relieve symptoms for many health conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Medical cannabis, or medical marijuana, is cannabis and cannabinoids that are recommended by doctors for their patients.The use of cannabis as a medicine has not been rigorously tested due to production restrictions and other governmental regulations. Evidence suggests cannabis can: reduce nausea and vomiting during chemotherapy, improve appetite in people with HIV/AIDS, help with anxiety/depression and reduce chronic pain and muscle spasms.

attributes.action: Make closed book GCSE English Literature OPTIONAL for 16 year olds in the UK
attributes.background:
Year 11 students face the huge task of taking a compulsory exam in GCSE English Literature. This is a closed book exam in which the study and  memorisation of quotes is essential . 
Surely this is an unnecessary waste of resources when there is already a compulsory examination in English Langauge.
attributes.additional_details:
The NSPCC reports a surge in the number of young people seeking help through the Childline support service specifically as a result of exam stress. 

We are concerned that the new style English Literature exam is inaccessible to students where poor language and literary skills prevail; its compulsory nature breeds unprecedented levels of stress.

Ministers wishing to tackle student mental health issues,  should consider the impact of their English Literature Exam policy; make it optional study .

attributes.action: Prevent President Buhari and all state Governors of Nigeria from entering the UK
attributes.background: Nigerian Government troops have entered SE Nigeria under Python Dance II. It's an act of provocation. The UK Government must act by banning President Buhari and all state governors of Nigeria from entering the UK.

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: Ban unsustainable Palm Oil from being used in produce that is sold in the UK.
attributes.background: The Palm Oil industry is linked to major issues such as deforestation, habitat degradation, climate change, animal cruelty and indigenous rights abuses in the countries where it is produced, as the land and forests must be cleared for the development of the oil palm plantations.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Start dredging rivers regularly in the help of flood prevention.
attributes.background: Cumbria has suffered many bad floods over the last 13 years and it's time something was done. Flood defences only slow down the water but actually clearing the rivers of silt and debris would be more effective. Also allowing farmers to manage rivers flowing through their land.

attributes.action: Let councils borrow to build council housing. Lift the government cap.
attributes.background:
Private tenancies are insecure, expensive and many fail to meet basic standards. 
So called "affordable housing" at 80% of market rents is not genuinely affordable. A programme  of council house building will help address the housing crisis, and council housing pays for itself in the long run.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules severely restrict council's ability to borrow to build desperately needed council housing.
Council housing funding also needs to be raised to a sustainable level.

attributes.action: The new sex education curriculum should explain what constitutes sexual assault
attributes.background: Social media phenomenon #MeToo revealed the under-reported prevalence of sexual assault. The new Relationships & Sex Education curriculum, due 2019, must explain to all genders exactly what constitutes sexual assault and harassment; both to prevent it happening and encourage victims to come forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Education secretary Justine Greening's much-needed, widely-applauded new curriculum covers consent, but doesn't specifically explain the arguably grey areas of sexual assault and harassment. Many victims of "minor" assaults don't understand that what they've experienced is a crime; or feel it's too common to be worth reporting. To reduce sexual assault and support the victims, we must first teach young people exactly what it is.

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN06103
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-trending-41633857
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/sexual-harassment-poll-yougov-young-people-night-out-a7972991.html

attributes.action: All residents of the United Kingdom to be issued with a Biometric Identity Card.
attributes.background: The introduction of Biometric Identity Cards would reduce time and costs to Government agencies in checking legal residents and citizens’ status, make ID checks by Police, Immigration and other official bodies impartial and puts every entitled resident/citizen on a level playing field.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently several ID card schemes in the UK including; Proof of age card, 'Gov.UK Verify', (described as an 'Online ID card), Passports and driving licenses, but not everyone has one and all of these are voluntary and not all are Biometric.
A National Biometric ID card would streamline the system, reduce costs and protect the law abiding legal residents and citizens in the UK whilst at the same time making life more difficult for those that choose to defraud or harm us.

attributes.action: Raise a Brain Aneurysm Awareness campaign
attributes.background: I recently lost my sister to a ruptured brain aneurysm. After numerous visits to doctors and hospitals for over a month. Not one of them even suspected this despite having all the symptoms of brain aneurysm.
attributes.additional_details:
One doctor suggested applying a hot water bottle to her head!!!
AWARENESS IS NEEDED.

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption and make it illegal.
attributes.background: Let’s get the Government to listen to the people. We need to stop forced adoption and make it illegal. Only parents should be able to consent to their children being adopted.
attributes.additional_details: There’s 25,000 plus children who are forcibly adopted in the U.K. each year by the secret family courts. These courts are not open to the public unlike criminal courts.  Parents who are party to proceedings are forbidden to talk to anyone about what happens in court. They’re silenced with a gagging order which means if they talk they face 10 years in prison, but it’s time the world knows what is going on in our family courts. Parents have already got the life sentence - isn’t that enough?

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fluoridation of the water supply to prevent tooth decay
attributes.background: Tooth decay is almost entirely preventable, but is the most common reason why children aged 5 to 9 require hospital admission. Water fluoridation is an effective public health measure proven to reduce tooth decay. Centrally funded and mandated water fluoridation is needed to protect our oral health.
attributes.additional_details:
PHE recommends fluoridation, but cannot enforce it. It's within the remit of local authorities, many of which do not have funds to implement it. 31 to 41% of 5-year-old children have evidence of tooth decay, with higher rates in deprived populations. 

PHE research reveals:

- 15% fewer 5-year-olds with tooth decay in fluoridated areas, rising to 28% when deprivation is considered
- 45% fewer hospital admissions of children aged 1 to 4 for tooth decay in fluoridated areas

attributes.action: Require in law that branding/ads must show a variety of real body shapes
attributes.background: The current position of the Committee of Advertising Practice is that “the use of thin models itself is not considered socially irresponsible.” Advertising Codes reflect UK Law. The Government should therefore make it a legal requirement for advertising to show a variety of real body shapes.
attributes.additional_details:
Images, models and mannequins inform our society:
“81% of 10-year-olds are afraid of being fat." (Rust, 2010 in ukessays.com) 
"The current media ideal of thinness for women is achievable by less than 5% of the female population." 
“…ample empirical research is available documenting associations between idealised images of female beauty and negative effects on women’s (and increasingly men's) physical, psychological, and social well-being (Thompson et al., 1999 in Calogero et al., 2007).

attributes.action: Introduce an Opt-Out Electoral Register (Automatic Voter Registration Bill)
attributes.background: TalkPolitics is calling for the electoral register to be operated on an 'opt-out' basis, rather than 'opt-in'. We are calling for all UK citizens to be automatically added to the electoral register before their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to;

- Ensure the 6 million people missing from the register are included,

- Save time and money by using an automatic system, similar to the National Insurance system,

- Take down an unnecessary barrier to democracy,

- Ensure everyone has a voice.

For more information on how the policy could work, read our in-depth policy analysis here: https://talk-politics.com/policy-analysis-automatic-voter-registration/

attributes.action: Put tuition fees back to £3000 per year
attributes.background: The cost of university tuition is ridiculous. Along with the scrapping of the maintenance grant, students can expect to be saddled with up to £50000 debt. £3000 per year can ensure that universities maintain high standards whilst students don't have to break the bank (as much).
attributes.additional_details: The government claims that this is no problem as there are loans, yet it is obvious with this year's decreasing number of people going to university that no one sees the benefit. Students can no longer afford a fun night out: they must work to top up their maintenance loan, and although the standard of tuition may have risen due to concern on whether it is value for money, the cost is putting the most disadvantaged off going as they can't face having all the debt.

attributes.action: Pass law requiring sponsors pay index-linked annual increases for DB pensioners
attributes.background: All company pensions should have annual index-linked increase, including those for pensioners that earned their benefits prior to 1997. This will not apply retrospectively but will ensure that in future all benefits earned during the working life of the pensioner are protected against inflation.
attributes.additional_details: In 1997 the Government passed a law that required index-linked annual pension increases on Defined Benefit (DB) pension sponsors. However pre 1997 service was excluded. There are some 100,000 pensioners who fall into this category. A fair solution would require relatively small amount of money. Many of the companies concerned took pension contribution holidays and benefited accordingly, have hidden behind the law and do not pay increments.It is not expected that increases should be retrospective

attributes.action: Put pressure on Israel to free the Palestinian 16 year old teenager Ahed Tamimi
attributes.background: Ahed Tamimi, a prominent 16-year-old Palestinian activist, was reported to have been detained during a pre-dawn raid on her home by the Israeli army and border police in the occupied West Bank.
attributes.additional_details: Ahed's mother, Nariman, is also said to have been arrested on Tuesday afternoon during a visit to Ahed at an Israeli police station.

attributes.action: Create a Devolved English Parliament
attributes.background: Scotland has the Scottish Parliament, Wales has the Welsh Assembly (soon to be Parliament) and Northern Ireland has the Northern Ireland Assembly. As the most populous country within the United Kingdom, England should also have a parliament to end the West Lothian Question.
attributes.additional_details: For too long England has had Scottish, Welsh, and Northern Irish MPs vote on matters that only affect England. It is time to have a devolved parliament to bring fairness and democracy to the region.

attributes.action: Adopt into UK law all anti-abuse measures of EU Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive.
attributes.background: Tax avoidance is widely accepted to be legal but both immoral and anti-social. As the EU’s anti tax avoidance directive can be universally accepted as a good thing and has not been a factor in public debate concerning the UK’s EU membership, the UK should opt in to the directive and implement fully.

attributes.action: Ban the cruel Glue traps in which Songbirds Kittens & Hedgehogs starve to death.
attributes.background: Glue traps don't just trap rats and mice, they indiscriminately catch any creature which has the misfortune to come into contact with them sentencing them to a lingering death in agony, until they die from starvation. The makers recommend disposing of the live, trapped victim in household waste.
attributes.additional_details:
Glue Traps are already banned Ireland and New Zealand.
Humane Society International have disturbing videos of all kinds of stuck creatures, trying to free themselves from glue traps which cause "hideous and even illegal cruelty” traps which 68 per cent of the British public would support banning. This can be seen at www.hsi.org
 
PETA, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, have fought these since they first went on sale. See www.peta.org/issues/wildlife/wildlife-factsheets/glue-traps

attributes.action: UK citizens should have the right to carry guns for self-defense
attributes.background: Given the current state of affairs in this country, people should be able to defend themselves and their families from terrorist and other criminal entities
attributes.additional_details: Enough is enough the terrorist has weapons why should people in this country live in the fear of being murdered in our own towns. If we are to be expected to live alongside people that want to kill us we should have the right to defend ourselves. Obviously, some kind of background checking system must be put in place if this is to work

attributes.action: Offer Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe diplomatic protection and secure her release.
attributes.background: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has been imprisoned unjustly in Iran and her case has been set back by Michael Gove and Boris Johnson’s failure to be clear about her motive for travel. She should be offered diplomatic protection and brought back to the UK, with her child Gabriella, as quickly as possible.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Nitrogen Dioxide exposure by expanding the UKs sensor network
attributes.background: Levels of Nitrogen Dioxide across the UK are constantly over WHO limits, causing detrimental damage to our health. Awareness of high pollution areas is still low as the monitoring set up covers very few locations so people cannot take informed decisions to reduce their exposure.
attributes.additional_details: Exposure to any amount of nitrogen dioxide impacts our health and  our children's health.  Despite this there is limited coverage of the exposure we face in our daily lives.  There are few monitors and no public information showing pollution across our transport network, in schools, offices and levels inside vehicles. We therefore call upon the government to increase awareness of NO2 exposure by funding additional sensors and research into hotspots so information is available to the public.

attributes.action: Protect Hospitals with exclusion zones preventing protest outside
attributes.background:
Over the past few years a number of groups have set up protests and vigils outside of hospitals. 

We believe this is unacceptable, and that people should be able to access healthcare free from harassment.

The obvious exception being union organised protest for staff.
attributes.additional_details:
We respect the right to free speech, and the right to protest. However, these rights are not without exception, and they cannot be used in a manner which causes harm. 

Individuals also have the right to go about their lawful business free from harassment, and protests and vigils outside the hospital infringe upon this. 

Protests and vigils can be held in a number of places throughout the country, but hospitals are a place for healing. They are accessed by people in their most vulnerable state.

attributes.action: Stop shops opening on boxing day
attributes.background: Please give retail workers an extra day off to spend with their families

attributes.action: Ban cigarette smoking in public areas.
attributes.background: Most people will agree that inhaling the poison in cigarettes should be optional. Yet we still have to breathe it in when simply walking in public. If you don't want to breathe in the health damaging smoke of passers by then sign this petition to get a government ban on smoking in public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking and passive smoking has serious health risks. We should all be allowed to choose whether we want to be subjected to those risks.

attributes.action: Use foreign aid money to help in the Caribbean.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous not to use our foreign aid budget to help in the Caribbean, let common sense prevail and quickly.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/853897/Hurricane-Irma-UK-British-overseas-territory-foreign-aid-Boris-Johnson-Theresa-May

attributes.action: Give inshore fisherman (non-sector & under 10m boats) 30% share of the UK quota
attributes.background: The inshore fishing industry should be legally entitled to 30% of all UK quota. The current system is based on historical quota allocation which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details:
Under 10m boats make up 77% of the UK fleet but their quota pool only accounts for 1.5% of the national Fixed Quota Allocations (in tonnes). This directly causes wide spread discarding of marketable fish. 

Please see paper titled, How Government and Fisheries management policies caused over fishing in UK waters, on The British Fishing Industry Facebook page.

attributes.action: Reopen the Hambleton Village Railway Station
attributes.background: I'd like to propose the reopening of Hambleton Village Station (closed in 1959) due to massive population expansion with the nearest alternative stations being Selby and South Milford. These trains pass the old station platform anyway and could easily stop to collect!
attributes.additional_details: The original station was located at the end of Station Road, Hambleton YO8

attributes.action: Re-nationalise the train service
attributes.background: Due to the privatisation of the train services, commuters have experienced frequent delays, with poorer service than would be expected of any EU country's services. On top of this, commuters face high fares, which are rising much faster than the rate of inflation.
attributes.additional_details: If we take Berlin and London, we can see a stark contrast in travel card prices there. For example, a day travel card in Berlin (zones ABC - which includes the city and its surrounding area) would cost an adult 7,70€ (£6.78), however, in London a day travel card (in zones 1-6) would cost an adult £11.70. The difference shows that a nationalised system is cheaper.

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Cancel plans to make banks check the immigration status of account holders
attributes.background: Starting in January 2018, UK banks will be required to carry out quarterly immigration checks on all account holders. Those found to be resident without permission will have their accounts frozen or closed down. This ramping up of the 'hostile environment' strategy will have disastrous consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Under the immigration act 2014, status checks are required for anyone opening a new bank account in the UK. A 2016 report by the chief inspector of borders and immigration uncovered a 10% error rate. The Home Office simply does not have the administrative capacity or competence to execute checks on 70m accounts without causing huge collateral damage. More fundamentally, attempts to decrease net migration by denying irregular migrants access to necessities are draconian and inhumane.

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting rules to prevent voter fraud
attributes.background: At the moment anyone can apply for a postal vote. The Government should change the way postal votes are allowed. Only people who are seriously ill or out of the country on holiday or business should be allowed to have them.
attributes.additional_details: Postal Votes are open to widespread abuse. The Government should change the rules to prevent systemic postal vote abuse.

attributes.action: Donald Trump should be refused entry to the UK
attributes.background: On account of his support for extremist organisations, and his lack of understanding of the consequences of his rhetoric, Donald Trump is not a fit and proper person to be permitted to enter the UK.

attributes.action: Give PCV licence holders category C1 licence aswell.
attributes.background: PCV holders or category D licence holders are able to drive any size bus e.g double deckers and bendy buses which can weigh in excess of 18 tonnes but cannot drive a vehicle which weighs less than half of this.
attributes.additional_details: Driving people around in a bus or coach is much more difficult than driving a small lorry half the size of the vehicles I can drive which weighs up to 7.5 tonnes. Even to drive certain vans which can weigh 4.2 tonnes cannot be done if classed as a normal van but if classed as a minibus it can be driven but the size is no different and neither are the tachograph laws.
